sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: Paulette Goddard, George Nader, Eduard Franz
Director: Reginald Le Borg
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLmHgXUJMN1TXEBMtSqYpWfok-xg95KXao
Explore a lesser-known screen appearance by Paulette Goddard, an actress whose career uniquely bridged Hollywood‚Äôs studio golden age and the evolving postwar film industry. Rising to fame in the 1930s, Goddard became one of the era‚Äôs most recognizable stars, admired for her intelligence, independence, and versatility across comedy, drama, and prestige productions. By the early 1950s, her roles were more selective, making this production an intriguing example of her later film work.

Set in the 9th century B.C., this sweeping Biblical drama unfolds in the ancient city of Jezreel, where King Ahab rules Israel and seeks to secure his dynasty through a politically advantageous marriage. Hoping to strengthen trade and power, Ahab takes Princess Jezebel of Phoenicia as his queen‚Äîdespite dire warnings from the prophet Elijah and the loyal statesman Naboth.

Produced by Lippert Productions, Inc. and Jezebel Productions, Inc., and directed by Reginald Le Borg, the film stars Paulette Goddard in a commanding portrayal of Jezebel, whose ambition, seduction, and devotion to the pagan god Baal plunge Israel into turmoil. George Nader plays Jehu, a celebrated soldier torn between duty, desire, and destiny, while Eduard Franz delivers a tragic performance as King Ahab.

Written by Richard Landau and produced by Sigmund Neufeld, the story traces Jezebel‚Äôs rise to power, the persecution of Elijah‚Äôs followers, and the devastating drought brought on by divine prophecy. As famine grips the land and faith is tested, Jehu ultimately rejects Jezebel‚Äôs influence, fulfills prophecy, and leads Israel toward restoration.

A vivid example of 1950s Hollywood Biblical filmmaking, this epic blends romance, betrayal, and spiritual conflict into a powerful tale of ambition and consequence.
